Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/e6b9796e0425d604ccf4dd4df2733721/tumblr_inline_n21lbxln7I1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="title=One%2Blucky%2Blanding&channel=spartling&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&chapter_id=3805627"></object></p>

<p><a href="http://www.twitch.tv/spartling/profile"><strong>Spartling</strong></a>'s got a bit of a problem. His craft has one leg and re-entry has gotten too fast for his liking. What happens next? Sweat is poured and nerves are shot. Will <strong>Spartling</strong> find glory by landing? Watch the video to find out.</p>

It's about time someone like me got highlighted! Someone who's orbital and piloting skills were, well let's say somewhat challenged! It makes us 'dumb kerbonauts' feel better to see someone else fail. Well almost;;; Boy, did he get lucky!
Why would Kerbals be called Kerbonauts? We're not called Humanauts, are we? Or even Americanauts.

Reminds me of the time I landed a rocket on kerbin after a mun flyby. Someone forgot, err... I meant misplaced the parachute. I swear the only thing that kept that rocket in one piece when it landed, was that Jebediah was flying. No parachute and no landing gear? Jebediah didn't care

Why would Kerbals be called Kerbonauts? We're not called Humanauts, are we? Or even Americanauts.

CosmoNauts.
